citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The facility failed to follow instructions provided by the Attending Veterinarian (AV) regarding the use of medications and
supplements for cats. The licensee administered foreign products that were not listed on the Program of Veterinary Care
(PVC) or authorized by the AV. The AV confirmed that these products were not approved for use.
Failure to follow the PVC or the AV’s directions undermines the AV’s authority and may result in inadequate veterinary
care, worsening medical conditions, and unnecessary pain or stress for the animals. The licensee must ensure the AV
has authority to direct veterinary care and to oversee the adequacy of all aspects of animal care and use. Correct by
September 26, 2025.

The licensee had no inventory records (APHIS form 7005) for any of the cats on the premises. The APHIS official counted
22 cats on the premises during the inspection. Additionally, the facility failed to maintain disposition records (APHIS form
7006) for cats sold.
Failure to document the required information on APHIS forms 7005 and 7006 interferes with APHIS officials’ ability to
identify regulated animals and trace their movements. Each dealer shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which
fully and correctly disclose the required information concerning each dog or cat purchased or otherwise acquired, owned,
held, or otherwise in his or her possession or under his or her control, or which is transported, euthanized, sold, or
otherwise disposed of by that dealer. Correct by 9/26/2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
